tool.name: Scanpy Read10x
tool.description: into hdf5 object handled by scanpy
tool.command: ln -s '${matrix}' matrix.mtx && ln -s '${genes}' genes.tsv && ln -s '${barcodes}' barcodes.tsv && PYTHONIOENCODING=utf-8 scanpy-read-10x --input-10x-mtx ./ --var-names '${var_names}' #if $cell_meta: --extra-obs '${cell_meta}' #end if #if $gene_meta: --extra-var '${gene_meta}' #end if @OUTPUT_OPTS@

param.name: matrix
param.label: Expression matrix in sparse matrix format (.mtx)

param.name: cell_meta
param.label: Cell metadata table
param.help: Requires a header row and index column that matches the barcode/cell table

param.name: gene_meta
param.label: Gene metadata table
param.help: Requires a header row and index column that matches the gene table

param.name: var_names
param.label: Attribute used as annotation index
param.help: If Gene ID is selected the index will point to the gene identifiers (first columns expected) and the gene symbols will be left in a field called 'gene_symbols'.

tool.help:
================================================================= Read 10x-Genomics-formatted mtx directory (`scanpy.read_10x_mtx`) =================================================================
The mtx directory should contain:
1) Raw expression quantification as a sparse matrix in Matrix Market format, where the each column is a gene and each row is a barcode/cell.
2) A gene table of at least two columns where the first column gives the gene IDs.
3) A barcode/cell table of at least one column giving the barcode/cell IDs.
The above-mentioned files can be obtained by running `EBI SCXA Data Retrieval` with a dataset accession or `Human Cell Atlas Matrix Downloader` with a project name/label/UUID.
Additionally, cell and/or gene metadata table can be provided as tab-separated text with a header row and an index column that matches the respective barcode/cell and/or gene table.
